entitledSupport.name: Personal Independence Payment (PIP)
entitledSupport.description: Assists with extra costs if you have a long-term health condition or disability that affects your daily life or mobility.

entitledSupport.name: Council tax reduction
entitledSupport.description: Discount on your council tax bill if you live alone or are on a low income. The amount depends on your local council’s scheme.

entitledSupport.name: Disabled bus pass
entitledSupport.description: Free or discounted bus travel if you have a disability that affects your ability to drive. Availability depends on your local council.
entitledSupport.urlText: Apply for a disabled bus pass

entitledSupport.name: Disabled persons railcard
entitledSupport.description: Reduced rail fares for disabled passengers and their companions, helping with transport costs for essential travel.
entitledSupport.urlText: Apply for a disabled persons railcard

entitledSupport.name: Mobility scheme
entitledSupport.description: Lease a car, scooter, or powered wheelchair if your receive certain disability benefits, making travel easier and more accessible.
entitledSupport.urlText: Find out about the mobility scheme

entitledSupport.name: Child tax credits
entitledSupport.description: Financial support if you are responsible for children, helping with the costs of raising them.

entitledSupport.name: Help with childcare costs
entitledSupport.description: Financial assistance with childcare costs if you are working and on a low income, supporting parents in employment.
entitledSupport.urlText: Find out about help with childcare costs

entitledSupport.name: Attendance Allowance
entitledSupport.description: Helps with extra costs if you have a disability or health condition severe enough that you need someone to help look after you.

entitledSupport.name: Access to Work
entitledSupport.description: Supports you to start or stay in work with funding for equipment, a support worker, or travel costs.
entitledSupport.urlText: Apply for or renew Access to Work

entitledSupport.name: Jobseeker’s Allowance (JSA)
entitledSupport.description: Provides financial support while you search for work. It’s quick to apply, and you’ll also get access to resources.

entitledSupport.name: NHS dental treatment
entitledSupport.description: Covers the cost of NHS prescriptions if you receive certain benefits or have a qualifying health condition.
entitledSupport.urlText: Check if you qualify for NHS dental treatment

entitledSupport.name: NHS prescriptions
entitledSupport.description: Covers the cost of NHS prescriptions if you receive certain benefits or have a qualifying medical condition.
entitledSupport.urlText: Check if you qualify for NHS prescriptions

links.text: Managing money with a long-term health condition
Find support groups in your area

supportApplications.name: Employment and Support Allowance
supportApplications.description: Provides support to help you start or stay in work if you have a health condition. This can include funding for specialist equipment, a support worker, or travel costs.
supportApplications.statusOverview: Your ESA application has been approved. You will receive regular payments to support you while you are unable to work.

paymentDetails.paymentMethod: Direct deposit to your bank account

contentBlocks.heading: What happens next
content: You do not need to reapply unless your circumstances change.
Your claim will be reviewed in June 2027 to check if you still qualify.

supportApplications.name: Universal Credit
supportApplications.description: Provides support for essentials like rent, bills, and daily expenses, giving you peace of mind when you need it most.
supportApplications.statusOverview: Universal Credit needs more information before they can process your application

contentBlocks.heading: What you need to do
content: Universal Credit has requested your last three months of bank statements to confirm your financial situation.
Deadline to submit is on the 15 June 2025.

links.urlText: Go to your Universal Credit account

contentBlocks.heading: What this means for you
content: Your application is still in progress, but it won’t be approved until the required documents are received. Once submitted, DWP will update you on the next steps.
You can contact Universal Credit support directly if you have questions about your application.

supportApplications.name: Blue Badge
supportApplications.description: Helps you park closer to your destination if you have a disability or health condition that makes it hard to move around. It can be used at home or when travelling.
supportApplications.statusOverview: Your local authority is reviewing your eligibility and will update you when a decision has been made.

subContent: Your council will check your application and supporting documents. This usually takes up to 4 weeks.
If further evidence or an assessment is required, your council will let you know. This can take up to 8 weeks.
You will be notified by email or post. Most applications are decided within 12 weeks, but it may take longer if extra checks are needed.

contentBlocks.heading: Get support
content: If you have any questions or need support, you can contact your local council.

supportApplications.name: Blue Badge
supportApplications.description: Helps you park closer to your destination if you have a disability or health condition that makes it hard to move around. It can be used at home or when travelling.
supportApplications.statusOverview: Blue Badge application was rejected because the assessment found that you did not meet the eligibility criteria.

subContent: If your condition has worsened or you now meet the eligibility criteria, you can submit a new application.
If you believe your application was wrongly rejected, you can ask for a review. You may need to provide new medical evidence or additional details about your mobility needs.
The deadline to request a review is on the 25 August 2025.

contentBlocks.heading: Get support
content: If you have any questions or need support, you can contact your local council.

upcomingActions.title: Submit appeal (if needed)
upcomingActions.content: If you’re unhappy with your Blue Badge outcome, you can appeal by 30th June 2025.

upcomingActions.title: GP follow up appointment
upcomingActions.content: You have a follow-up appointment to discuss medication adjustments for rheumatoid arthritis.

pastEvents.title: Blue Badge approved
pastEvents.content: Your Blue Badge application was approved. The badge will arrive by post within 7 working days.

pastEvents.title: Employment Support and Allowance approved
pastEvents.content: Your ESA application was approved. You will receive £390 every two weeks, your first payment on 20 June 2025.

pastEvents.title: Work capability assessment completed
pastEvents.content: You attended your ESA Work Capability Assessment. The assessor confirmed further processing is required before a decision is made.

pastEvents.title: Employment Support and Allowance submitted
pastEvents.content: You submitted your ESA application, including evidence from your GP and specialist.

pastEvents.title: Specialist appointment
pastEvents.content: You attended a rheumatology appointment. The specialist confirmed the severity of your condition and provided a report.

pastEvents.title: GP appointment
pastEvents.content: Your GP confirmed your diagnosis of rheumatoid arthritis and issued a referral to a specialist.
